    1: import os
    2: import platform
    3: 
    4: from pip._vendor.rich import inspect
    5: from pip._vendor.rich.console import Console, get_windows_console_features
    6: from pip._vendor.rich.panel import Panel
    7: from pip._vendor.rich.pretty import Pretty
    8: 
    9: 
   10: def report() -> None:  # pragma: no cover
   11:     """Print a report to the terminal with debugging information"""
   12:     console = Console()
   13:     inspect(console)
   14:     features = get_windows_console_features()
   15:     inspect(features)
   16: 
   17:     env_names = (
   18:         "CLICOLOR",
   19:         "COLORTERM",
   20:         "COLUMNS",
   21:         "JPY_PARENT_PID",
   22:         "JUPYTER_COLUMNS",
   23:         "JUPYTER_LINES",
   24:         "LINES",
   25:         "NO_COLOR",
   26:         "TERM_PROGRAM",
   27:         "TERM",
   28:         "TTY_COMPATIBLE",
   29:         "TTY_INTERACTIVE",
   30:         "VSCODE_VERBOSE_LOGGING",
   31:     )
   32:     env = {name: os.getenv(name) for name in env_names}
   33:     console.print(Panel.fit((Pretty(env)), title="[b]Environment Variables"))
   34: 
   35:     console.print(f'platform="{platform.system()}"')
   36: 
   37: 
   38: if __name__ == "__main__":  # pragma: no cover
   39:     report()
